ccines, at 13 months 
and three years. Most adults 
in Northern Ireland will have 
developed immunity to rubella 
from having had the infection 
previously or having been 
vaccinated. Your antenatal 
rubella screening test will 
show if you are immune or not.
If you are not immune to 
rubella,	you	will	be	offered	two	
MMR vaccines, at least four 
weeks apart, after the birth 
of your baby (unless you can 
produce evidence from your 
GP of having had two MMR 
vaccines previously).
